definition: pocket/bag/to wrap up or hold in a bag/to move in a circle/to canvas or solicit/to take responsibility for/to disclose in detail/combat armor (old)
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
erhua variant of 挎兜[kua4 dou1]

sentences.english: Romance is every time I eat a bowl of left Douer you will help me to pass out.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫是我每次吃饭留下的碗兜儿你都会帮我打发掉。

sentences.english: Is it possible that you put it in other pockets?
sentences.chinese: 会不会是在别的兜儿里？

sentences.english: Oh, I remember. I put my passport in my pocket.
sentences.chinese: 哦，对了，后来我是把护照放在兜儿里了。

sentences.english: Which pocket did you put it?
He put his hand into his pocket and drew out his passport.
sentences.chinese: 他把手放进兜儿里，掏出了他的护照。

sentences.english: Is it possible to be in your pockets?
sentences.chinese: 会不会是在你的兜儿里？

sentences.english: Daniel, does your clothes have pockets?
sentences.chinese: 大牛，你衣服上有兜儿吗？

definition: to put into (one's pockets, clothes)/Taiwan pr. [chuai3]
full and bulging (of a pocket, pouch etc)
embroidered pouch for carrying loose change etc/purse/pocket (in clothing)
an undergarment covering chest and abdomen
